comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Probably Brandram Boileau USSHER, Canadian R. E. bishop, born in Dublin, Ireland, 6 August, 1845 (according to famousamericans.net/brandramboileauussher/) According to THE DOCTOR'S WHO'S WHO of 1906 he was in Boston resp. Dedham, Mass. at that time (www.archive.org/stream/doctorswhoswho00mouluoft#page/239/...) The Kansas City journal., July 23, 1897, Page 8, Column 2 "COMMUNION SET MORTGAGED" says that Bishop B. B. Ussher had founded a Christ Reformed Episcopal Church in 1889, which was later disbanded. The Ashland tidings., February 17, 1916, Page 5, column 2 mentions a Bishop B. B. Ussher of Boston. Brandram Boileau Ussher died in 1925, see e.g. archive.org/search.php?query=creator%3A%22Ussher%2C%20Bra...
